ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: ITAL 120 is an excellent introduction to Italian language and culture. Students learn every verb tense in Italian and conclude the semester by reading a selection from Boccaccio's Decameron and by making several short presentations on Italian art and culture. Students write a short essay once a week (no more than 250 words) and take a test every week and a half. While I do not know much about the other instructors, Prof. Iacovella was amazing! She brought Italian coffee, pastriesand treats to several classes. She took us on a visit to the Yale art gallery and to an authentic pizzeria in Guildford, CT. Not only is she from Italy and well-versed in Italian culture, she is extremely kind and eager to help students learn. Take the course!
At first it might seem overwhelming but in retrospect, I feel like this is one of the best taught languages on Yale's campus. Take Italian if you want the best experience learning a language at Yale.

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who has some experience in Italian. The class was fun and informative. I would recommend it to someone who would enjoy conversing in italian and doing presentations.
